catalog_info.title: The Role of Government
catalog_info.prereq: Course open to Freshman Students Only
catalog_info.description: The course will examine the role of government from an economic perspective. We will start with the classical welfare theorems that show that laissez-faire can achieve an efficient outcome. We will discuss how these theorems depend on a legal system that upholds contracts and protects property rights as well as on the absence of externalities or public goods. We will consider the cases for income redistribution and for government nudges. Throughout we will intersperse discussion of concepts with policy issues, such as freedom of speech, gun control, global warming, drug laws, kidney sales, and Obamacare.
